page.title: 07AMENITIES.POSTLING
page.content: The area is very poor in amenities of any kind. There are four foot paths and the Pilgrim's Way which cross the east of Monks Horton and the north of Postling,and the North Downs Way which runs along the high ground. The former are walked at intervals by the Sellindge Footpaths Association,and the latter by hikers from farther afield. Farthing Common is used as a picnic halt in the summer by motorists travelling along Stone Street. An old chalk pit on the drop from the Downs at Hempton Hill provides a temporary mini-circuit for young motor-cyclists. There is a small site at Page Farm, Postling for touring caravans run in association with the Caravan Club.
